snippet: In ending its combat role in Afghanistan a year earlier than expected, the United States will rely more on special forces that hunt insurgent leaders and train local troops, officials say.
abstract: United States' plan to wind down its combat role in Afghanistan a year earlier than expected relies on shifting responsibility to Special Operations forces that hunt insurgent leaders and train local troops; if approved, the plan would be the most significant evolution in the military campaign since Pres Obama sent 32,000 troops to wage an intensive and costly counterinsurgency effort.

byline.original: By THOM SHANKER and ERIC SCHMITT

lead_paragraph: In ending its combat role in Afghanistan a year earlier than expected, the United States will rely more on special forces that hunt insurgent leaders and train local troops, officials say.
